review.room_type: Suite Executive
review.comment_positive: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are very attentive. The staff at reception, in the restaurant and in the bar were all incredibly friendly, welcoming and professional throughout my stay. There was a half bottle of red wine and some fruit waiting for me when I entered the room which was a lovely touch. The breakfast was of a high quality and I liked the fact that there was a bit of variety each day with the food. The rooftop bar is lovely and I was impressed by the happy hour cocktails. The hotel is located in the Old Quarter, within walking distance of many restaurants and tourist attractions.
review.comment_negative: The gym is located in the basement,  and in the afternoon, the hotel's laundry is disposited and then picked up from there which is a bit surreal. Ideally, there would be a wider range of television channels available in rooms, including some foreign language channels for overseas tourists.

review.comment_positive: We spent a total of 5 nights at Acoustic Hotel & Spa and felt well looked after during our entire stay. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating to our needs and questions. I must say, the location of this hotel is perfect. It is right between the Old + French Quarter, which means it is walking distance to restaurants/cafes but out of the way enough for a more peaceful/quiet stay. The room was clean and very comfortable, we even took advantage of the Spa Services and got a discount! They helped us organize a Ha Long Bay Tour, which is great as there are so many options and it can be daunting to know which to choose. They allowed us to leave our luggage while we stayed on the cruise overnight which was very convenient. We cannot recommend this place enough!

review.comment_positive:
Breakfast was awesome, best we had in Vietnam also the addition of free afternoon tea was great. I loved how comfortable our bed was, some people had complained about beds being too hard, this is one of the reasons I chose this hotel hoping for a firm comfortable bed. Location was good for a lot of tourist sites, Prison, museums, church   
etc. We were offered a shower in Spa before boarding our late train which they upgraded to allowing us to use a private room for 40mins which was greatly appreciated. Also it is only a short distance to the Railway.
All the staff were very lovely and helpful with great English making it easy for us.
review.comment_negative:
I have stayed in better areas closer to more Restaurants but the convenience of being close to a lot of tourist locations made up for this.
I did have a problem with being hit up for full payment almost immediately after stepping through front door. After 3 flights and a total of 20hrs travel and being very tired I found this extremely annoying. No other hotel in Vietnam did this to us.

A great experience and indulgence staying at this hotel.

review.rating: Nice Boutique Hotel Centrally Located near Hoan Kiem Lake
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: The reason I booked this hotel is its central location right in between Hoan Kiem Lake and Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum. It was a great decision as their rooms are also nice and their staff so professional and accommodating. It was easy for us to book airport pickup and dropoff, leave our bags at the lobby, and ask for fresh towels in the room. Their restaurant at the top floor has good views of Hanoi and serve healthy and delicious food for breakfast. You'll find lots of good noodle restaurants across the streets make sure to try the local chicken noodle soup as it's one of the best noodle soups in the world! We could eat the noodle soups all day and we never got tired eating them. The famous lake is just a quick 15-minute walk from the hotel and so we enjoyed walking around here for two evenings, eating street food, watching people, and taking pictures by the water. It was my second time in Hanoi and would definitely come back again as I love the vibe of the old city so much.

Location was great, walking distance to the lake, surrounding food options and local shops.

Buffet breakfast/restaurant upstairs was good, lots of options. All staff were really friendly and nice, especially to our kids.

Thank you Acoustic for a fabulous stay.

review.comment_positive:
We finished our trip in Vietnam with a 4day stay at The Acoustic Hotel in Hanoi.
The accommodation was great, the buffet breakfast was lovely and the rooftop bar was awesome (particularly the Margaritas).
Most of all though, the customer service was excellent... the staff were on hand at reception, by phone and by WhatsApp at all hours and even prior to check-in or after checkout to make sure all our needs were met. They provided restaurant recommendations, booked airport transfers and arranged a fantastic excursion to Halong Bay with Arcady Cruises.
Thanks very much to all the staff for a perfect end to our holiday

review.rating: A comfortable hotel, good value for money with good breakfast and excellent service crew!
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: The room was spacious and the water pressure in the shower was great. Amenities in the room were sufficient and the room had a good working safe and fridge complete with drinks if you want to purchase.  Coffee and tea were also available.  Breakfast was really great with a good selection of starters, mains, desserts and fruits.  Service staff were amazing. They were polite and accommodating, took care of my needs and were very attentive.  The General Manager, Mr Thu Nguyen, was amazing!  In the early morning he would come and greet the hotel guests at the breakfast floor, ensuring that the guests were well taken care of and after most guests were done with their breakfast, he would be very busy at the reception area attending to all the guests' needs - whether it was helping arriving guests with check-ins or arranging transport for those leaving the hotel or going to the airport.  He and his team of service crew would attend to the hotel guests' needs with great smiles on their faces.  The great service and hospitality really made a huge difference making you felt it was like a home away from home. Love the hotel and the amazing service crew and this would be my choice hotel whenever I come back to Hanoi!
review.comment_negative: Initially, pillow was a little hard and uncomfortable just like what the reviews from others shared but when I informed the General Manager of the hotel about this, he immediately informed me that they were planning to change all the pillows when their new pillows arrived.  He said there might be some already delivered to the hotel and although they were supposed to make the change only after all the stocks had arrived, he would change mine first.  And he did! I returned to the hotel later in the evening finding out that the pillows were changed!  So now there was really nothing that I didn't like.  All feedbacks were taken seriously and remedied!

review.rating: Seriously, I recommend this hotel to everyone.
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Deluxe Gi∆∞·ªùng ƒê√¥i C√≥ Ban C√¥ng
review.comment_positive: Well, I loved just about everything. The room was great, the mattress terrific, the bathroom sparkling, and everything extremely comfortable. Really great location for walking to restaurants and shopping. the best part was the staff. They are the sweetest, most helpful people in the world. I had a world class missed connection and baggage loss problem, having been sent to bloody Qatar for no damn good reason. The hotel staff interfaced with the idiot airlines people many times to try to get my bags delivered. Kim was a true champion. I love her. She was incredible communicating with me while I was miles away on Cat Ba while my bags were in London. The restaurant staff are also very sweet. If I could stay at Acoustic every time I stay in a hotel anywhere in the world, I would be ecstatic.

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Deluxe Gi∆∞·ªùng ƒê√¥i C√≥ Ban C√¥ng
review.comment_negative:
Guests should be aware that there is ongoing construction adjacent to the hotel, which can result in noticeable noise levels. During our stay, the noise was significant enough to disturb our rest after a long journey.
The hotel staff acknowledged that this has been a point of concern for other guests. Despite this, they continue to accept reservations. This was particularly inconvenient for us, as we had specified our need for a quiet environment due to work commitments.
In terms of customer service, we experienced delays in receiving a refund after cancelling our reservation. It took several weeks and multiple communications to resolve the issue. There are a variety of other accommodations available in Hanoi that may offer a more satisfactory experience.
Please find included a picture of the construction site right next door.

Update: After posting my original review, the hotel reached out to me to discuss my experience. They suggested a refund for my stay in exchange for removing my review. While I appreciate the offer, I've chosen to keep my review posted to help future guests make informed decisions. I stand by my initial observations and believe it's important for others to know what to expect when staying at this establishment.

review.comment_positive:
I recently stayed at the Acoustic Hotel & Spa in Hanoi and had an incredible experience. The communication with the staff was outstanding, and they made my stay truly special.

They went above and beyond by arranging airport transfers, which was incredibly convenient. Additionally, I was able to easily rent two scooters from the hotel for exploring the city.

The hotel itself is a hidden gem in Hanoi, with beautifully appointed rooms and fantastic spa services. If you're looking for a hotel that offers great service, excellent communication, and additional conveniences like scooter rentals and airport transfers, I highly recommend the Acoustic Hotel & Spa. I can't wait to come back!

review.comment_positive:
The staff - very very welcoming and friendly. That is generally always the case in Vietnam, but here even more so.
The Hotel - is very spacious, modern and nice. The lobby and the rooms are quite big, bed was very big and comfy. Room had a smart TV with Netflix. Bathroom was spacious with a big shower.
The Location - great to explore the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, Temple of Literature etc. on foot. If you want to get to the centre of old town by foot it will be around 20 minutes, a Grab (Vietnamese Uber) will cost you about 40.000VND (which is around 1.75 Euros)
The airport shuttle - was very very very nice. Great pricepoint at 350.000VND which makes it around 50.000 more expensive than Grab but it wad absolutely worth it.

review.comment_positive: Everything about the hotel was exceptional. Location was excellent, being in the Old quarter and close to the city centre. Our room was fabulous (we had a suite), facilities included a roof top bar and 2 hot tubs. We used the Spa, my wife got her nails done and I had a massage. Lovely breakfast with a great selection of hot and cold food including an egg station. All of the staff in the hotel ( including the managers ( sorry I forgot your names) were really polite and friendly and could not have done enough for us to make us feel welcome. The staff were so helpful in recommending which trips to book and which we really enjoyed. We booked our hotel transfers with the hotel which removes any hassle getting to and from the airport. We have to make a special mention to Nam who made our check in so easy and he ensured we were satisfied with everything. Also Kim who worked on reception. Kim was so lovely, she was so attentive and greeted us every day with her beaming smile and genuinely interested in what we had planned each day. We will most definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you to you all for making our stay so enjoyable. 10 out of 10

review.comment_positive: The staff is trained exceptionally well. We received a warm and informative welcome, staff were always extra friendly and forthcoming in assisting. We were so happy with the hotel, staff and location that we cancelled our booking for the 2nd hotel later during the trip and rebooked Acoustic again. During the initial stay we were in Deluxe rooms. Those rooms are nice though a bit small. For the 2nd stay we were upgraded to a family room (larger, 2 beds, balcony) and a larger city view room which an extra size king bed. Rooms were generally as in pictures though a bit smaller. Breakfast is plentiful, good quality and has a good variety. It's locate on the outskirt of the Old Quarters but just nice enough to walk wherever you might want to go within 5-15min. There's also a street with good local restaurants and coffee shops literally 2 minutes away. Will stay here again for future trips.

review.comment_positive: There are no words to describe the level of service and friendliness of each and ever staff member of this hotel . Oanh went above and beyond to help us reschedule plans last min even on her own time . Alice and her breakfast crew were simply amazing they made us feel like a part of the family !! The lady on reception was so lovely kind and helpful and the concierge men were beyond sweet . The hotels breakfast was one of the best iv ever had as a vegetarian at a hotel with a huge selection and fresh everyday. We had massages which were terrific and although the gym is small and compact it‚Äôs perfect for a quick workout. review.rating: Can't recommend highly enough - we came back three times!
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive:
I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel: 

The rooms are large, fairly modern, furnished to a high quality and the beds are comfy. The bathroom is also spacious, with good water pressure and is well stocked with everything you might want. 

The staff are exceptional, from reception to the sales manager to those on the door. In particular Kim was fantastically helpful during our three (!!) stays here, organising everything from laundry, luggage storage whilst we travelled to other parts of Vietnam, signing for and storing a package we had delivered to the hotel, organising cars to and from the airport and helping us book tours. 

The the breakfast is large and varied, it's a mix of buffet and a la carte, and also varies each day (with some staples).
review.comment_negative: The gym is small, quite basic but has a bench, free weights and some cardio machines, it's also not air conditioned. Keep in mind if it's a priority for you.

review.comment_positive:
Wir waren w√§hrend unserem Aufenthalt in Vietnam f√ºr ca. 10 Tage in Hanaoi mit Unterbrechungen f√ºr verschiedene Ausfl√ºge.  Den ersten Aufenthalt buchten wir √ºber Booking.com. Nachdem uns der Aufenthalt extrem gut gefallen hatte, entschlossen wir uns die restlichen N√§chte direkt im Hotel zu buchen. 
Das Personal ist Klasse und erf√ºllt alle W√ºnsche. Unseren Ausflug in die Ha Long Bucht haben wir auch direkt hier gebucht. Wenn sie einen Trip dort hin planen sollten sie auf jeden Fall die 3 Tages-Tour machen. Es lohnt sich! Alleine schon wegen der Anfahrt und dem unvergesslichen Erlebnis. Alles verlief reibungslos. review.rating: Outstanding Staff and Central Location Close to Everything While Far Enough Away from the Noise
review.room_type: Suite Junior CoÃÅ Ban C√¥ng
review.comment_positive: There's so much that I absolutely loved about my stay at Acoustic Hotel & Spa, but what stood out the most was how kind and attentive the staff were.  Everyone no matter what job, position, or title, was helpful, cherry, informed, and knowledgeable.  No matter if my question pertained to sightseeing recommendations or tours or just a good restaurant nearby to eat, the staff was always quick to offer assistance and guidance.  I feel like the staff played an even more pivotal role in my review now (some weeks after I've returned home) because after staying on a cruise ship on Halong Bay and my subsequent stays on my Asian vacation, Acoustic Hotel & Spa are where I had the best genuine interactions with over my two (2) weeks abroad.  As a result, if you're avid solo traveler like me and you're stuck debating between which hotel to choose, I'd say go with the one with the friendliest staff as that's always a HUGE factor for me.

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: The online / Whatsapp customer service from this hotel was very friendly and helpful in advance of our stay. They responded extremely quickly when booking transfers and organising the exact Halong Bay cruise we wanted. The staff at the hotel were all very keen to help and the bed was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was great - huge range, including vegan sushi. The roof bar had great views and nice cocktails. The location of the hotel is great, for the railway station and accessing all the major sites, and lots of restaurants nearby. Good A/C.
review.comment_negative: The furniture in the bedroom was classic and we were given an upgraded room when we arrived, without it being requested. However, it's clear that just like everyone else worldwide, the hotel is recovering from the pandemic, when looking at the bathroom. it was nicely designed and lots of little DIY attempts have evidently been made to keep it going, but it does need a redo. Given the high level of service and organisation this hotel provides, I expect they will be able to do so quickly :)

review.comment_positive:
Our stay at the Acoustic really exceeded our expectations. Throughout our stay and even before we arrived, the staff were so helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome, nothing was too much trouble. The early airport pick up was very smooth despite traffic. We were greeted by Kim and Thu (the hotel manager) and checked in by Annie who explained all about the various services and features of the hotel plus information about available tours and things to do in Hanoi. We decided on the 1 day Halong Bay cruise and left it to Annie to arrange it. Also took the Hop On/ Off city tour and went to the Water Puppet Show.
Our room was on the 10th floor with a city view and small balcony. It was very hot at this time of year but the air conditioning kept us cool and comfortable. Great bathroom with big shower enclosure and rain shower. The bed was huge and very comfortable, great pillows too. 
Breakfast was served in the 11th floor dining room and had a big selection of both Vietnamese and Western dishes. Afternoon tea was also served every day. 
The hotel location was excellent for walking to most of the well known spots and only about 10 minutes from the lake. We loved our stay here and the great service of all the staff, highly recommended.

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: The staff were amazing and always ready to assist with anything. The location was perfect, not too far from anything. The breakfast was very good, much better than most hotel buffet breakfasts. The rooms are beautiful and very clean.
review.comment_negative: The main downside was the noise, both guests checking out and staff starting to clean before 7am on the weekend were very loud. Our room was also missing the latch lock (we did not feel unsafe but prefer having this lock in all hotels).

Insbsondere Kimmy, die uns bzgl. dem Organisieren von Ausfl√ºgen, Tickets f√ºr das Wasserpuppen-Theater sowie Transfers betreut hat, verdient ein riesiges Lob! Really great job!

review.comment_negative: Vietnam is only just opening up, so many of the restaurants and some hotels are still closed, however Hanoi was busy and I'm sure tourism will improve, however it was a nice time to visit before the crowds return. I would definitely stay here again.

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: Great and very nicely designed hotel in Old Town Hanoi. We stayed here for two nights during our trip to Hanoi and have really enjoyed our time here. Everything within the old town is in walking distance and the Acoustic hotel offers a nice retreat from the hectic and loud city. A free afternoon tea is offered daily on the top floor with some nice views. The rooms are big, well equipped and have a beautiful classic style. Above all, the staff here is highly professional, super nice and everybody speaks English very well. Big thanks to Justin and the entire team who made our stay so great and rememberable. They even offered us a place to rest for a few hours after we had returned from our tour to Ha Giang Loop late at night and were waiting for our transport in the morning. - Lisa & Markus

review.comment_positive:
We experienced a fabulous welcome to this hotel. We arrived here after a night in Halong Bay and found the staff to be friendly and knowledgeable. We booked a family room which was smaller than the hotel we had stayed in previously but the beds were very comfortable and we had a small balcony as well. Everything was neat and clean.

We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which included fresh-made options such as pancakes, Croque Monsieur, pho, bun, mien, eggs, etc. 

My husband and son enjoyed a soak in the jacuzzi on the rooftop where the skybar is located. To use the jacuzzi you need to book it t least 30mins in advance.

Location-wise, we were happy to not be in a noisy area though walking distance from a number of attractions and the Old Quarter. 

Staff are helpful and friendly. Justin, at the front desk, always greeted us with a warm smile.

We enjoyed our stay!

review.rating: Perfect place to stay in Hanoi
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive:
I had the best stay in this hotel, primarily because of the staff. The customer service was exceptional! Even before I arrived, they already kept in touch with me and made sure that I had a great stay. From the driver that picked me up, to the staff that facilitated my check in (the lovely welcome drink, fresh fruits, and cold towel were much appreciated especially after the airport delays I went through that day) and allowing me to check in early, the lovely staff at the breakfast room, arranging my Halong Bay tour, sending me the train schedule for Train Street, and allowing me to take a shower even after I had already checked out to prep me for my night train. 

I also loved the lobby (serene and welcoming) and my room. I liked the color scheme, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was nice and clean (I really liked the fact that they used refillable bottles for shampoo, conditioner, and body gel). The breakfast had a good selection and was quite filling, and the location was perfect for walking around the city.

review.rating: Overall a great place to stay with value for money.
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Deluxe Gia ƒë√¨nh
review.comment_positive: Acoustic hotel and spa is a four star hotel in a central location with easy accessibility to the main sights of Hanoi. We stayed in the the family suite (premium section of the hotel newly opened 2 months ago) and must say extremely spacious, clean rooms and bathrooms.  Two Bathrooms.  One  had both shower and bath tub included.  View from our room was not too great but unlike what other reviews said there was no noise from the street filtering into the room.   The staff were great especially Ms. Kim.  Extremely courteous, helpful in all aspects.  She guided us on our points of interest in extreme detail.  In fact the entire staff were at all times very friendly.  Good buffet breakfast with variety of continental and Vietnamese options with a live counter. Great location. Walking distance to the train street (worth the hype), lake, night market, cathedral, loads of restaurants and caf√©s nearby including Indian ones. Overall a great place to stay with value for money.

review.rating: this a great little place to explore Hanoi from

review.comment_positive: This hotel was great right from walking in the door. They easily made arrangements for a car to pick us up, check in was quick with a friendly staff that had the room waiting and cooling for us on arrival. The spa is great. very reasonable and convenient. The food is good. The minibar prices are good. The location is good. They‚Äôre right next to the HopOn Hop Off as well so it‚Äôs also accessible that way. Smooth friendly check out. upon arriving at the airport we had accidentally left personal items in the car and panicked. They quickly sent the car and driver directly back us and we made our flight. The hotel feels very safe and friendly and we enjoyed our stay there. Would definitely stay there again

The room was smaller than advertised. Somewhat cramped and not clean. The safe was not working; I locked it, left and when I returned to the room, I found the safe open. I reported these issues and asked if I could be moved to a different room. 

The staff member on duty told me that the only option was to pay for an upgrade, $70 plus a night but they would offer it to me for "only" $30. If a guest has a genuine complain about their room, I don't think it is appropriate for staff to attempt to upsell. 

The staff were genuinely helpful but overall, I don't think the rooms and facilities warrant the cost of this hotel. There are better options available.

review.comment_positive:
Wir haben zum zweiten Mal auf unsere Vietnamreise in diesem Hotel √ºbernachtet und es war wieder ein Genuss hier zu sein. Nicht nur das sich das Personal noch an uns erinnern konnte. Auch haben wir wieder ein kostenloses Upgrade auf eine Suite erhalten. Man sp√ºrt einfach sofort wenn man das Hotel betritt, damit das ganze Personal m√∂chte das es einem gut geht. Das Zimmer war sehr sauber und sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet. Das Fr√ºhst√ºcksb√ºffet war wieder sehr reichhaltig und variantenreich. Auch wird nachmittags ein kostenloser Tee mit kleinen Snacks im hauseigene Restaurant serviert. Den Abend kann man von der Rooftopbar mit einem sch√∂nen Blick √ºber Hanoi ausklingen lassen. 

Besonders erw√§hnen m√∂chte ich Mrs. Kim die uns diesmal wieder geholfen hat unsere Weiterreise nach Cat ba zu organisieren und das wieder mal sehr kurzfristig von unsere Seite. Auch hat sie uns angeboten wenn wir von cat ba nach Hanoi f√ºr unseren Weiterflug zur√ºckkommen, das wir gerne auch ohne eine weitere Buchung unser Gep√§ck im Hotel abstellen k√∂nnen. 

Das haben wir dann auch einige Tage sp√§ter danken angenommen und auch noch das hauseigene spa ausprobiert. Die Massagen von mir und meiner Partnerin waren sehr professionell und entspannend. Nach einer kurzen Dusche sind wir dann frisch und entspannt zum Flughafen gefahren. 

Das Hotel ist vom Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis unschlagbar und w√ºrde ich jedem empfehlen der eine Unterkunft in Hanoi sucht.

Staff
- They really are the best hosts! They are very polite and greets the guests upon entering and leaving. I had a bit of stomachache and they offered to give some tea to help relieve the pain. We also need to check out early for our flight and they are kind enough to ask if we would like to pack a breakfast meal along the way. They are very attentive to your needs  while waiting in the lobby (offered bottle waters, candies, and fruits)

Room
- We got a free upgrade and the room was really clean with a balcony. The bed was really comfy and soft. There‚Äôs also daily cleaning of the room by the housekeepers after lunch (new towels and toiletries). It‚Äôs not that noise-proof since we can hear the footsteps and elevator outside our door.  

Location
- Very accessible and easy to locate. There‚Äôs also nearby attractions and souvenir shops.

Breakfast buffet
- It was really amazing with a variety of choices (food and drinks). The also have very hospitable staff during breakfast. The food was delicious and served fresh.

Rooftop bar
- It had a nice vibe and a great view. The drinks by the bartender was yummy as well.

review.comment_negative: The hotel is extremely noisy. You can hear literally everything. The pipes in the bathroom are making A LOT of noise. Every morning there  was water on the floor in our bathroom. The ac in our room was leaking and had to be fixed. The staff is friendly but a bit all over the place. When we were checking out, v early in the morning, we got to the reception and they were asleep. When the ac was leaking they sent a person who wasn't speaking in English so the person came and after 10s left. We didnt know if he is coming back. I called the reception after 15min to check whats going on. They didnt even know that he came already, were is he etc. We came back to the hotel after the whole day of sightseeing and we had to leave the room bc of the AC repair. Noone said "we are sorry foe the trouble" or anything. For all of the inconveniences and issues the hotel manager offered a free airport transfer and, to my surprise, they cancelled my booking reservation a couple of hours before our check out. Super strange behaviour. The stay wasn't comfortable nor relaxing. I wouldn't recommend it

We could not even keep the curtains open and the proximity made it feel unsafe (see photo of "view" into someone's home almost touching the balcony). Upper floor rooms do not have this problem but the view is abysmal and the "balcony" is teeny tiny and pointless. The lane in which the hotel is situated is not nice. 20 min walk to lake. Would recommend picking a hotel near Hoan Kiem Lake to make the most of your stay in Hanoi.

review.room_type: Suite Executive
review.comment_positive: The staff of this hotel is incredible and go the extra mile to make sure you have everything you need. The Acoustic hotel's furnishings exceed a 3 star, the rooms large and well appointed, comfortable King sized bed, the location close to all the sights but remained a quiet sanctuary from the bustle of Hanoi. The breakfast buffet and made to order eggs and soups were the best we had during our 25 day trip in Vietnam. We loved this hotel so much that we booked extra days making it our base in Hanoi while we explored Ha Giang and Ha Long bay. A special thanks to Ms Kim, Ms Oanh and Ruler who made our stay exceptional and treated us like family. The rooftop bar serves the best cocktails and the view from it and the dining room are spectacular.
review.comment_negative: More hangers and hooks in the rooms are needed, the staff provided us with more hangers when we asked. The coffee offered at breakfast in the restaurant was bland and weak perhaps offering stronger options, like excellent Vietnamese drip or espresso for those who prefer a stronger option. Another (small) annoyance, that we encountered in a few hotels in Vietnam, is that the room doors sounds an alarm if not closed quickly enough, therefore we were awoken a couple of times by others returning in the night. Other than that the hotel is very quiet.

review.comment_positive:
What a great hotel! Perfect location, fantastic rooms and super comfortable beds. The staff are just phenomenal. Nothing was too much of a trouble and they really went out of their way to make my time in Hanoi enjoyable. The showers were some of the best I've had, and small touches (the cleaning team noticed I always removed half the pillows, so they made my bed with less pillows!) made this place a stand out :-) 
I was in Hanoi to support a friend, and the staff checked in with me to make sure I was ok and showed concern when I was eating at strange times of the day - really kind and above and beyond.
The hotel is ideally located and walking distance to almost everything you would want to see in Hanoi.

review.comment_positive: The staff at this hotel are without doubt, the best in Hanoi, if not of anywhere I‚Äôve ever stayed in the world. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Every time we returned from a day out we were greeted by name and welcomed back. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped and the birthday cake they arranged for us was beautiful. The location is great, in between Train Street and Hoan Kiem lake; a 6 minute walk to each. The daily complimentary afternoon tea was a lovely touch and the roof terrace fantastic. My son also had some laundry and dry cleaning done and this was very cheap and a fast service. I had a foot massage and a facial in the spa and this was really relaxing. I also spent some much needed quiet time sat in the beautiful reception with a complimentary juice before a busy day. I will absolutely return here next time I am in Hanoi.

review.comment_positive: Outstanding service. The manager Justin was attentive and helpful. Even offered to transport our luggage from another hotel to theirs. Helped my partner (who was terrified of Hanoi traffic) to cross the road. They upgraded our room because it was our last night in Hanoi, and the room was definitely spacious. I rarely  find hotel shampoo and conditioner to be in good quality, but theirs didn't make my hair feel coarse at all. Also love that we could control the AC temperature, so we could turn it off and save electricity. Impressed by the automatic buffet trays at breakfast, because it helps keep food warm and away from contamination.
review.comment_negative: Toothbrush was a little poorly designed, with some loose bristles. Hair dryer was typical of old school hotels and needs an upgrade; luckily we brought our own. Hand bidet pressure was way too strong, although we experienced this at another hotel, so we're wondering if it's a Hanoi thing lol. Would be a great upgrade if they offered universal adaptors (although to be fair, we didn't ask if they had any).

review.comment_negative: For the second half of our stay we were given rooms on the 8th floor. These rooms were significantly better in condition and view compared to the rooms on 2nd floor given to us during the first half of our stay.

review.comment_positive: Loved all of the staff, the people are so warm, welcoming and helpful. They really make the place a great option to stay. They contact you via whatsapp to help you with airport transfers, will help you book tours, find restaurants and bars and anything else you can think of. The hotel is in a great location and our room was really comfortable, we had a fairly small room but there are larger options that look really lovely. I like that the hotel has a rooftop bar, the bar staff mix a killer cosmo and the breakfast was awesome!
review.comment_negative: There were a few things that could be improved on but didn't negatively affect our stay in any way - the afternoon tea and the rooftop bar were a bit understocked so we looked outside for those things. The on site spa was not as good as one just down the road but again there's a spa on every corner so it's not really a problem. And the hotel is a little more run down than online images show but they are doing refurbishment and post covid I feel all pre existing hotels should be given a 3-5yr grace period.

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel, and I must say, it was an absolutely amazing experience! From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel incredibly welcome and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was exceptional.

One of the standout features of this hotel is the exceptional service provided by the staff. They were not only friendly but also extremely helpful. The hotel employees were always cheerful and willing to assist with any request or inquiry we had. From the gentleman opening the door for us, to the receptionist, and the breakfast staff, everyone greeted us with a warm smile and made us feel right at home.

We were particularly impressed by the hotel's response to a noise issue in a neighboring building. As soon as we notified them about the disturbance, they immediately upgraded our room at no additional cost. This unexpected gesture completely surpassed our expectations and truly demonstrated their commitment to guest satisfaction.

Moreover, the hotel staff went out of their way to ensure our comfort and convenience. They even arranged a shower for us before our train journey to Sapa. This thoughtful gesture was greatly appreciated and made our transition to the next leg of our trip much more enjoyable.

The hotel itself was beautiful and well-maintained. The rooms were spacious, clean, and had all the amenities we needed for a comfortable stay. The breakfast provided was delicious with a wide variety of options to choose from, catering to different preferences.

Overall, our experience at this hotel was exceptional, and we would definitely choose this place again without hesitation. The friendly and helpful staff, combined with the incredible service they provided, made our stay truly memorable. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our stay so fantastic. We look forward to visiting again in the future!

review.rating: It is passable for a day or two in Hanoi
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive: Acoustic Hotel & Spa is located in a prime location from where you can go to nearby attractions such as Hanoi night market, Train street,  Vietnam Military History museum etc. There are plenty of restaurants, department stores (Winmart), Spa centers that provide very good foot massage at reasonable price, money exchange in the vicinity. If you are looking for luxury brands then there is one branded mall near the hotel namely Trang Tien Plaza (10-12 minutes' walk or you can go by bus within 5 minutes) which has a decent movie theater (CGV cinemas). The hospitality of the hotel staff was admirable during check-in as they will make you feel quite special with a very nice welcome (including welcome drinks, good behavior, wet wipes etc.). They will also explain to you everything in the vicinity clearly so that you have a clear idea of nearby attractions. The room was comfortable (though a bit old-fashioned), and bathroom was clean and cozy with plenty of amenities. They provided good microwave service to warm our food till 11 pm.
review.comment_negative: Acoustic hotel & Spa fails to satisfy its customers with a poor breakfast service. First of all, if you are welcoming guests on an international level then you must know about their religious differences and cultural diversities. This hotel serves breakfast with a limited options (not more than 4-5 main dishes). Out of their 4-5 main items, most of them were pork (even in the rice). Some of the items did not have any name label on them (whether beef/pork/chicken/lamb etc.). In the first morning, we found one beef item but it was unsatisfactory afterwards. On the 2nd day, when we asked the service personnel in the kitchen whether a particular item with no name was chicken or pork, after hesitating for a few seconds, she replied that it was chicken. However, after having the first bite, I realized that it was pork and asking for the 2nd time, the girl said it was pork. We made a complain about it at the reception and apparently they took it seriously by sending us an apology e-mail, nevertheless, it was all similar menu in the breakfast the next day. That same girl was showing us some tofu pretending that we were vegetarians, but we made it clear at the reception that they should at least keep one chicken/beef item (even if sausage) in the buffet breakfast. In our 4 nights stay, we were disappointed with the breakfast on 2nd and 3rd day, and didn't even go to the breakfast on the 4th day. The hotel management again apologized to us while we were checking out but it was too late for that because on two days, we had whole day trips and really needed a good breakfast service. In other hotel, we had better service (with both fish & beef in buffet) and also by getting complimentary fried rice without pork upon request. Lastly, the room was kind of small to accommodate our luggage because our requirement was one king size bed in the room whereas they combined two single beds to make one huge bed which took most of the space in the room.

The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I could also leave my luggage there on the day I left until it was time to go to my night train.
The breakfast buffet offers a big variety of food, from western food, like toast and all that stuff to fried rice or Pho soup, which I liked very much.

My room was also very quiet at night time. Basically always quiet.
Beds were rather hard, which I liked very much.

review.comment_positive:
We arrived at Acoustic 04/11 from Ho chi minh...from the minute we walked in we were welcomed by the friendly and accommodating staff. The breakfast each morning was amazing with an extensive selection to choose from. 

Reception are amazing, once they have your number on whatsapp they keep in regular contact. I used them often to ask for advise on places to eat, they even booked our day tour to Ninh binhn and our overnight stay at Halong Bay.¬† Of course after our Halong Bay visit we came back to stay another 2 nights before flying back to New Zealand. While we were at our overnight stay they held our luggage and organised laudry to be done on our return. The first part of our stay we had the family suit which was spacious and comfortable. When we returned we had the junior suite that was just as good...both had balconies.  

Today was check out and they organised our taxi to the airport. Because we had to leave early morning they offered takeaway breakfast. 

Thank you to the team (cleaners, cooks, front of house, day spa and door men) from acoustic who made us feel at home for the 7 nights we stayed.

No doubt I will recommend to my friends and family who visit.
review.comment_negative: Nothing everything was beyond expectations

review.comment_positive:
The hotel staff are absolutely first class. We arrived early before the check-in time and simply wanted to drop off our luggage, but they allowed us to check in early at no additional cost. While our rooms are being prepared, we were invited to relax at the lounge with complimentary drinks and snacks. They offer a good selection of guided tours, including a day trip to ninh binh which we booked and throughly enjoyed (the staff even got us a discount)
On our departure day, despite not having booked breakfast, we were pleasantly surprised to be offered breakfast. The spread and quality is really good. Even had pho, noodles and eggs that are freshly cooked to order.
Truly one of the best hotel that we have stayed at.

The staff is polite and friendly and very accommodating. We really enjoyed our stay!

review.comment_positive:
Extremely accommodating! Answered all my questions prior to my trip. The concierge representative contact me directly and were able to provide me information on applying for Vietnam visa when I couldn't get any answers from the Vietnam embassy in my country.

They also gave me early check-in which was extremely helpful for me to explore Hanoi even more! I absolutely love this hotel and the amazing team! They also provide complimentary afternoon tea!

review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
Ph√≤ng Deluxe Gi∆∞·ªùng ƒê√¥i C√≥ Ban C√¥ng
review.comment_positive: Staff was great and super helpful. Breakfast was good, it was nice that you can order different dishes every morning from the menu on top of the buffet. Location was ok, not that close to old quarter but ok walking distance away. Room was cleaned well, we had a complimentary fruit basket in the room.
review.comment_negative:
Surfaces in the room were somewhat worn out, and there was some visible water damage in the bathroom, tiles were cracked etc. You could hear all the noises from the hallway. The walls/windows were so thin, that it felt like the windows were open because the traffic noises were so loud, and it was a little hard to sleep. 

Update // They asked us to do a written review about the hotel upon check out. We wrote same things on that and here in the booking review. Mostly great things about the service and staff, only complaints was the noises and the fact that the room might need some updates/renovations. We waited in the hotel lobby for a car to pick us up to the airport, and the manager came to us apologizing and they gave us a 50% refund from the car service. We thought that was unnessecary, but it felt nice that they reacted to our feedback. I also wrote this booking review waiting in the lobby, usually I wait to get out of the hotel to do that, I should‚Äôve done it now too. The manager had seen my booking review and came back to talk to us, asking us to change the review from 8 to 10. We felt super uncomfortable that he asked us to do so. We just wanted to get out of there as fast as possible. For that point we had nothing but great things to say about the staff, but now it left us with a bad taste to our mouths, and this wasn‚Äôt a great ending to our 2-week trip to Vietnam, which had been nothing but lovely so far. I had to lower the grade because we didn‚Äôt appreciate this kind of doing.

Great location, could walk to the sights that we wanted to see.  I booked a room with a balcony (think it was a junior suite), well worth the money and great to have a bit of outdoor space in a city.

Breakfast was good, lots of choice including fresh cooked eggs, Pho etc

The staff were really helpful, nothing was too much trouble.  They noticed that we had an early flight so made us a packed breakfast including hot tea (before the kitchen was open).

I would like to thank all the staff as they were really friendly and helpful

review.comment_positive: Staff couldn't be more helpful, giving us use of an uncleaned room or the spa shower to change on arriving out of check in/out time and even when we just wanted to store our luggage for a few hours before our sleeper train some days before our stay. Best breakfast buffet we had in Vietnam. Room was great, good shower, comfy bed. Location very good for central Hanoi. Nice bar on the roof.
review.comment_negative: I hope in future the hotel can provide a better rate than 100% for use of a room for a few hours when arriving at 6am on check-in day when the booked room is not yet available, which must be common. This may be due to limited discretion for the person manning reception at that time of day. In the end we just used the spa area for free, which was good enough, but we'd have been happy to pay for a room for a few hours, just not almost as much again as our 2-night stay.

review.comment_negative: The room we had was very small. Family room with 2 king beds but not much room for 1 person to negotiate moving around let alone a family of 4. It was much smaller than most premier inn family rooms we have stayed at. Not much wardrobe space for storing clothes or belongings. There was no luggage storage space in the room at all which was an issue for a family of 4 with luggage for more than a couple of days. We booked a 5 night stay which was incorporated into a 3 week stay, but had booked based on the price and that we would only actually be sleeping there 2 nights due to a Ha Long bay cruise for 2 nights and checking out early on our last night for a night flight.

review.comment_positive: Staff were polite. Room was clean.
review.comment_negative:
We had a bad experience here. To begin, we arrived around 12 and were told, understandably, that our room was not ready. We were "offered" the chance to pay an extra 40USD for an "upgrade" to a bigger room that was ready. When we declined, the staff went to check our room and, lo and behold, the room was suddenly ready. I know it was the same room, as I had requested that the hotel arrange the room nicely to reflect the fact that the stay was part of an anniversary gift (to the hotel's credit, this arrangement was done and done quite nicely). I will leave readers to draw their own conclusions from this.

Our stay coincided with Tet (Lunar New Year), and we were expecting things around the city to be closed. We had booked the hotel in large part due to it offering what appeared to be a highly rated restaurant and rooftop bar. We thought we might spend a couple lazy days in Hanoi watching the celebrations and at least be able to get food and drink in the hotel when we wanted. It was only after we had checked in, and payed the entire amount of the stay up front, that we were informed that the bar and the restaurant were shut for the entire duration of the stay. Room service was also not available. We weren't even told this by a member of staff. In fact, before check in, the staff made sure to let us know about the great services in the hotel. It was only upon reading  a sign that had been stuck up beside the elevator on the 2nd floor (conveniently not posted in the lobby of the hotel) that we finally found out that those services would be closing an hour after we had checked in and would remain closed for 5 days.

As regards the room itself. It was clean and comfortable. However the walls are PAPER THIN. When housekeeping or other guests spoke in the hallway, it sounded like they were inside our room. You hear every footstep taken and every trolley moved. It was not particularly pleasant in the mornings.

review.comment_positive: The staff are very kind and helpful, and are happy to organise trips and transport for you. The roof top bar is also lovely with a great view of the city.

There is construction going on next door, which we only found out about upon arrival. They warned us there may be some noise but we weren‚Äôt prepared for the level! Sounded like the construction team were literally hammering on and drilling directly on the other side of our wall, from very very early! We came back later in the week for one more night on our way back from Sapa and we in a room on the other side of the building which was significantly quieter.

The aircon also broke one night for a few hours, which definitely makes a big difference in summer in hanoi!! The staff were able to fix after a few hours and were very apologetic.

The restaurant closed at 8 (despite saying it‚Äôs open until 10) so just be aware if you are travelling and planning to grab food there. There‚Äôs lots of places nearby for food though!

review.comment_positive: The staff was accommodating and courteous. Even before my trip, one of them reached out to me via text and I was able to ask her any questions I had. The staff assisted me with booking transport from the airport to the hotel, day tours to Ninh Binh and Ha Long Bay, and spa packages. Breakfast was delightful as there were different dishes and fruits every day. To our utmost surprise and delight, there was even a complimentary afternoon tea daily for all hotel guests which served as a perfect respite from the afternoon heat. The location of the hotel was fantastic too since it was in the Old Quarter - we pretty much walked our way around the entire area/to all the major tourist attractions without taking any other forms of transport.

review.rating: Experience the best guest service in Hanoi!
review.room_type: Ph√≤ng Senior Deluxe Nh√¨n Ra Th√†nh Ph·ªë
review.comment_positive:
We enjoyed very much our stay in Hanoi. We stayed 2 times in the hotel during our stay. We love the location in the old town near the must-dos - shops and tourist attractions. It's very safe we walk everywhere in the old town. We love the food options and shops around the area as well the breakfast in the Hotel! 

The front desk crew especially Rachel & Tommy, and the team were amazing! Anything you ask or are concerned about they are so resourceable. We needed it to check out at 9 pm so we paid another night for a basic room for a couple of hours.  I was traveling with my aunty and she needed to rest before we caught up on the 1 am flight. They made sure our stay was relaxed and comfortable. They upgraded our room and it made a huge difference in relaxing and catching the flight! Thank you so much! 

This is the type of hospitality we are grateful for while traveling. It is the staff that makes a huge difference! We have been to many properties around the world but this one will be unforgettable! Even though the ups a downs they make it work! We felt at home and the team was so caring! We enjoyed the facials and pedicure thank you-Hien and Thanh! Thank you Rachel & Tommy and team! See you all during our next stay in Hanoi!
review.comment_negative: For our second reservation, we book the premium suites next aile of the building. We were disappointed when we came back from our trip to Danang because they closed the internal door that connected the main building as we saw on our first stay.! Not having internal connected doors for both buildings feels detached and unwelcoming for guests since it seems like 2 different properties!  Every time we go to breakfast 11th floor, we need it to get out of the hotel and go next door building! We will come back but we will stay in the main building.
